Dear Ms. Koziara:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Concerns of supervision at the facility as one youth has
sexualized behaviors and is grooming other youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 10/18/2024. Staff 3
was informed by Youth E that Youth A and Youth C kissed while
on a hiking trip in July prior to Youth C leaving the facility.
Staff 3 reported she was informed from Staff 4 that Youth A was
acting “weird” in the kitchen on video footage reviewed while Staff
1 and Staff 2 were working.
Staff 3 was informed by Staff 4 that Staff 1 was not maintaining
line of sight on Youth A as he was staring at his cell phone.
Staff 3 reported Youth A has high grooming behaviors and is
concerned for other youth at the facility as staff are not
supervising appropriately.
Staff 3 was informed through an email Youth A was able to access
pornographic material on the computer at site office while doing
online therapy. Staff 3 reported staff are supposed to remove the
mouse from the computer to prevent Youth A from being able to
get on inappropriate websites however this did not occur. Staff 3
did not know who the staff was that did not remove the mouse and
keyboard.
Staff 3 reported Youth A has a history of inappropriate sexualized
behavior with Youth B which was previously investigated (SI
2024C0001084SI).
2

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/24/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported last week she and Youth B were both singing an
inappropriate song at the facility. Youth A reported she did not
have any sexual contact with Youth B.
Youth A reported she never went into Youth C’s bedroom and
never asked Youth C to have sex with her.
Youth A reported Youth B told her that Youth B and Youth C
kissed while on a hiking trip. Youth A reported she did not recall
which hiking trip it was or the staff that were on the hiking trip.
Youth A reported she did not see Youth B and Youth C kissed as
Youth B and Youth C were running ahead while hiking. Youth B
told Youth A about Youth B and Youth C kissing after the hiking
trip.
Youth A was not aware of any other youth at the facility having
any sexual contact while at the facility.
Youth A reported she is on a safety plan at the facility which
includes not allowed to be alone with any other youth at the facility
due to an incident that occurred between her and Youth C
(2024C0001084SI). Youth A reported she did touch Youth B’s
shoulder last week at the facility as Youth B was upset and she
was attempting to calm Youth B down as Youth B had a pair of
scissors in her hand and Youth A was concerned what Youth B
would do with the scissors. Youth A reported Staff 1 was present
in the dining room when this occurred however on his phone.
Youth A reported she does online therapy on the computer at the
facility. Youth A reported when she is on the computer staff take
away the keyboard and mouse, so she is unable to access any
websites on the computer. Youth A reported there was a recent
incident at the facility where there were inappropriate websites
accessed on the computer down at main site however it was not
her and it was verified by the facility that it was not her as the
times did not match up to when she would have been on the
computer for therapy.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/24/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported she and Youth A were “goofing off” and singing an
inappropriate song at the facility. Youth B reported Staff 1 and
Staff 2 were present.
Youth B reported Youth A has never inappropriately touched her.
Youth B reported recently she was upset about some news she
received, and Youth A attempted to calm her down and Youth A
placed her hand on Youth B’s shoulder. Youth B reported Staff 1
was present.
3

Youth B denied ever kissing Youth C, including while on a hiking
trip. Youth B denied ever running ahead of staff on a hiking trip
with Youth C. Youth B reported had she and Youth C ran ahead,
staff would have told them to come back.
Youth B reported youth are not allowed in one another’s
bedrooms at the facility. Youth B heard Youth A went into Youth
C’s bedroom as she heard staff, unable to recall what staff, talking
about it.
Youth B reported she is not aware of any youth having any sexual
relations with other youth past or present at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/24/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported the only incident that ever occurred between him and
Youth A was already investigated (SI 2024SIC0001084SI).
Youth C reported Youth A ever came into his bedroom at the
facility.
Youth C reported he kissed Youth B while he was on an off-
ground hiking trip however refused to provide any information
other than Staff 4 and an unknown named female staff were on
the hike with the youth. Youth C reported he and Youth B ran off
into the woods and Staff 4 told them to stay by staff. Youth C
reported he and Youth B would run a head of Staff 4 and the
unknown female staff and then wait for them to catch up and run
again. Youth C reported no staff or youth know about him and
Youth B kissing.
Youth C reported he had sex with Youth D while at the facility last
year. Youth C reported Staff 5 was working and fell asleep in the
dining room and he had sexual intercourse with Youth D in the
kitchen. Youth C reported Staff 5 was asleep for two seconds and
then walked into the kitchen where Youth C and Youth D were.
Youth C reported Staff 5 acted like nothing happened however
talked to Youth C about it the next night. Youth C reported he did
not recall what Staff 5 talked to him about. Youth C reported no
other staff or youth witnessed this and it was the only time.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on 11/6/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker as Youth D is no longer at
the facility. Youth D reported one time Staff 5 fell asleep at night
while Youth C and Youth D were watching a movie. Youth D
reported Staff 5 was “knocked out” for about twenty minutes and
was snoring. Youth D reported she and Youth C kissed while
Staff 5 was sleeping. Youth D denied ever having sexual
intercourse with Youth C at the facility. Staff 5 woke up and told
Youth C and Youth D to go to bed. Youth D reported there were
no other youth at the facility at the time this occurred. Youth D
4

reported Staff 5 never said anything to her about the incident, but
Youth C told Youth D Staff 5 talked to him the next day and told
him he never wanted to see that happen again. Youth D reported
she and Youth C were writing notes back and forth to each other
initially when they both first got to the facility however that ended.
Youth D reported staff, unsure who, found a note in her room and
one in Youth C’s room while doing room searches.
Youth E was attempted to be interviewed via telephone on
11/6/2024 and 11/12/2024 as Youth E is no longer at the
facility and back the parental home. No return calls were
received.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/24/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported he has only worked in the house once as he is normally
assigned to another house at the organization. Staff 1 reported at
the beginning of his shift he reviewed shift notes to see updates
on the youth in the house as he was not as familiar with Youth A
and Youth B. Staff 1 reported he was aware Youth A is on a
safety plan due to her previous interactions with a male youth that
is no longer at the facility. Staff 1 reported Youth B had received
bad news during the shift. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not
physically touch Youth B. Staff 1 reported he is not familiar with
Youth A and Youth B’s normal interactions with one another as he
reported Youth A and Youth B have been at the facility for a while
together and have appeared to form a friendship. Staff 1 reported
he did not have any concerns with Youth A and Youth B’s
behaviors or interactions towards one another nor did he think
there was any sexualized behavior exhibited on the shift he
worked. Staff 1 did not recall Youth A or Youth B singing any
inappropriate songs during the shift he worked. Staff 1 reported
he feels kids are properly supervised at the facility. Staff 1
reported no youth at the facility are ever allowed to be alone
together and is not aware of any situations or times any youth
have been alone together.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/24/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
reported Youth A and Youth B were hanging out at the facility
laughing and being normal girls. Staff 2 reported Youth B had
received some bad news earlier in the day and was feeling down.
Youth A and Youth B were singing “my neck, my back” song,
goofing off, and being silly. Staff 2 reported she did not see Youth
A or Youth B being inappropriate at any time. Staff 2 reported
later video footage was reviewed and noticed Youth A and Youth
5

B had a stuffed animal and when they were singing the song, they
were touching the places on the stuffed animal to correlate with
the song. Staff 2 reported none of the youth are ever left along
together at the facility together. Staff 2 reported Youth A does
have sexualized behaviors however not high grooming behaviors
currently. Staff 2 reported Youth A is receiving specific therapy
online to address her sexualized behaviors. Staff 2 reported when
Youth A has online therapy down at the main site building, the
mouse and keyboard are removed so Youth A is unable to access
the internet during therapy.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/24/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4
reported he was not at the facility at the time of the concerns with
Youth A and Youth B however had reviewed the video footage.
Staff 4 reported Youth A and Youth B were singing an
inappropriate song and Youth B was reenacting the song lyrics by
touching a teddy bear per the song lyrics. Staff 4 reported Youth A
did not touch Youth B inappropriately at all during this incident.
Staff 4 reported per the video footage, Staff 1 was on his cell
phone and was not paying attention to Youth A and Youth B and
Staff 2 had her back to Youth A and Youth B. Staff 4 reported he
spoke with Staff 2 following the incident about always having eye
on supervision. Staff 4 reported he did not speak with Staff 1 as
Staff 1 is not a normal staff assigned to the house. Staff 4
reported he was never on a hike with Youth B and Youth C where
Youth B and Youth C were running a head. Staff 4 reported he
normally is in the back of the group when hiking as Youth A tends
to be slower and he typically will stay in the back with Youth A.
Staff 4 reported he has never taken his eyes off the youth during
waking hours at the facility since a prior investigation
(2024C0001084SI). Staff 4 reported no concerns with supervision
at the facility other than this incident where Youth A and Youth B
were singing an inappropriate song and Staff 1 and Staff 2 did not
address the behaviors.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 11/6/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker as Staff 5 is no longer
employed at the facility. Staff 5 reported he was employed at
the facility from August to November 2023. Staff 5 reported Youth
C and Youth D were at the facility while he worked there. Staff 5
denied ever falling asleep at the facility or Youth C and Youth D
ever being unsupervised in the kitchen. Staff 5 reported he
always maintained line of sight of the youth at the facility unless a
youth was in their bedroom or using the bathroom. Staff 5
reported the only discussion he ever had with Youth C regarding
6

appropriate boundaries was he told Youth C not to pass notes to
Youth D as Staff 5 had heard Youth C was passing “inappropriate”
notes to Youth D. Staff 5 did not recall if he heard about the
“inappropriate” notes being passed from another staff member or
read it in shift logs. Staff 5 had no knowledge of what had been
written in any notes that were possibly passed between Youth C
and Youth D.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 10/24/2024 and via telephone on 11/6/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief Administrator reported
Youth B was escalated as she had received some bad news
about home and Youth A attempted to calm her down by touching
Youth B’s shoulder. Chief Administrator reported Youth A is not
supposed to touch any youth and this is being addressed with
Youth A. Chief Administrator reported she did hear through the
rumor mill something about youth planning to kiss on a hiking trip
however did not have any other information regarding whether it
occurred or not. Chief Administrator reported she heard there was
some concern about inappropriate website(s) being viewed on the
computer at main site however it was not confirmed that it was
Youth A. Chief Administrator reported Youth A does online
therapy at main site however is monitored by staff through the
glass door and the keyboard and mouse are removed from the
computer. Chief Administrator reported the concerning website
was not accessed on the computer Youth A uses for therapy and
upon information technology looking into the situation and it was a
pop up add, not a seared website. The facility has separate logins
for all the youth at the facility and can see who searches what
when the youth are logged in at the facility. Chief Administrator
reported no knowledge of note passing occurring between Youth
C and Youth D. Chief Administrator did hear some concerns from
various staff, unable to recall who, concerns when Staff 5 was
working at the facility that Staff 5 would come in to work tired.
Chief Administrator reported Staff 5 had a second job and worked
night shift at the facility. Chief Administrator reported she never
had any proof of Staff 5 sleeping on shift as he was the only night
staff at the house during the nighttime shift when the house
reopened prior to cameras being installed in the house. Chief
Administrator reported Staff 5 was only employed a few months
prior to giving his notice. Chief Administrator reported no
knowledge of Youth C and D having any physical contact while
placed in the house together.
Video Reviewed:
7

Video footage of 10/15/2024 in Cedar Creek living room area was
viewed on 10/30/2024. Youth A and Youth B are seen sitting on
the floor next to one another and can be heard laughing and
singing the song Lick It. Youth B was holding a stuffed animal and
was pointing to the body parts on the stuffed animal as Youth A
and Youth B sang the lyrics of the song. Youth A and Youth B
were not viewed to have touched one another in any inappropriate
sexual manner.
Video footage of 10/15/2024 in Cedar Creek dining room was
viewed on 10/30/2024. Staff 1 was sitting at the table looking at
his cellphone while Youth A and Youth B were near each other at
the end of the table. Youth B was sitting in the chair and Youth A
was standing next to Youth B. Youth A and Youth B were
laughing. Youth A touched Youth B on the shoulder with bother
her hands. Youth B got up from the table and moved toward the
sliding door to the back deck with something, unclear what from
the video. Staff 1 was looking at his phone. Youth A approached
Staff 1 from behind and tapped him on the shoulder and pulled at
his shirt for him to notice Youth B was moving toward the door.
Staff 1 got up, Youth A ran over to the door and followed Youth B
outside. Staff 1 followed behind.
Documents Reviewed:
• Behavior Management Plan/ Trauma Safety Plan for Youth
A dated 12/6/2023: Youth A has had inappropriate sexual
relationships with peers. Youth A’s triggers include lack of
supervision. Staff must ensure Youth A has appropriate
boundaries with other youth in the home. Youth A is only
allowed to touch other youth if it is a fist bump or a high
five. Youth A will not be alone with other youth. Youth A
will be taught using the teaching family model by
addressing positive and negative behaviors and attaching a
negative or positive point consequence. Staff are to provide
verbal prompts to Youth A when necessary.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Safety Plan for
Youth A dated 9/25/2024: To ensure the safety of Youth A
and male youth in the home, as well as preventing any
future incidents of Youth A and male youth having physical
interactions with each other, the following safety plan has
been implemented: Staff will maintain proper supervision of
Youth A and male youth when they are in physical
proximity of each other. Youth A will not be permitted to sit
by male youth on the couch, in the vehicle, at the dining
8

room table, nor will Youth A be allowed to have a bedroom
down the same hall as a male youth.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Safety Plan for
Youth A dated 9/30/2024: Youth A will be monitored 100%
of the time by staff while on the internet. Youth A will not be
permitted to use anyone’s cell phone or device. Youth A will
not be left alone with peers without supervision.
• Cedar Creek staff schedule for September and October
2024: the facility is staff with two workers on daily for each
shift during waking hours.
• Cedar Creek Program Statement Supervision: Youth are
supervised when they are with another youth in the
program by staff through eyes on supervision.
• Technology Usage and Digital Communication Policy:
Personal cell phone use while working is permissible for
incidental amounts of times, however, cell phone use,
including text messaging, shall not impede business.
Employees shall refrain from using cell phones while
working directly with clients, except when necessary for
case consultation.
• Prohibited Conduct Policy: Sleeping on duty is strictly
prohibited and subject to disciplinary action up to and
including termination.
• Staff 1 and Staff 2’s personnel files: Staff 1 and Staff 2 had
no discipline in their personnel files. Staff 1 received
supervision training on 8/5/2024 and Staff 2 on 7/29/2024.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: Staff 4 had one discipline dated
12/26/2023 for providing supervision. Staff 4 received
supervision training on 6/24/2024 and 10/17/2024.
• Staff 5’s personnel file: Staff 5 had two disciplines in his
personnel file, one dated 9/20/2023 for sleeping on shift,
and 10/6/2023 for not completing paperwork. Staff 5
received supervision training on 8/14/2023. Staff 5 resigned
from the facility 11/18/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance for following their internal
supervision policy and procedure. Per interviews with Youth B and
Staff 4, they indicated Staff 1 was on his cell phone while at the
table and not paying attention to Youth A which was confirmed on
video footage review.
Staff 5 denied ever sleeping on shift however both interviews with
Youth C and Youth D reported Staff 5 was sleeping on shift and
not properly supervising Youth C and Youth D. Staff 5’s personnel
9

file also documented a written discipline for Staff 5 sleeping on
shift.
Per interviews it is unclear if Youth A and Youth C were properly
supervised on a hiking trip as Youth C reported he and Youth A
were running a head of Staff 4 and another staff, unable to recall
who, and kissing. Youth A denied this ever occurred as well as
Staff 4 reported Youth A and Youth C never ran ahead while on a
hiking trip with him.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The facility retrain all staff on supervision expectations and cell
phone use while on shift.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2024C0001084 dated 2/7/2024, CAP Approved 2/13/2024
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
